topic.title: Query Workbench
topic.shortdesc: This topic is a sample to test if Carole Anne Videan can produce a document.

body.p: The Query Workbench is used to enter a Query about data held in a Couchbase repository using the N1QL Editor. The results or errors and help messages are displayed below in the Results section.
From the Couchbase Console select the Query tab:

section.title: Selecting a Data Bucket
section.p: Under Bucket Analysis is a list of all the Data Buckets available.
Click the Data Bucket you want to run a Query on.
The Data Bucket is expanded to display the data structure or Schema.

section.title: Entering a Query
section.p: Click in the N1QL Editor and type the first line of your query.
Then select the Enter key and type any additional lines.
Note: A list of Query commands is available at LINK.
When all the Query commands are entered click the button to run the query and display the results in the Results section.

section.title: Viewing Results
section.p: The Status returned by the Query is highlighted in red above.
If the Query is successful the Status will display "executing", then "success" and display the results in the Results section.
If the Query has failed the Status will display an error code or "error" and will display an error messge indicating why it has failed in the Results section.

section.title: Getting More Information About an Error
section.p: Click on the arrow to the left of the Clear History button to run the Query again and display different information:

section.title: Running Another Query
section.p: Click the Clear History button to remove the Query results.
Correct or replace the Query and click the Execute button again.
